questions.question_text:
A technician is troubleshooting a report about network connectivity issues on a workstation. Upon investigation, the technician notes the workstation is showing an
APIPA address on the network interface. The technician verifies that the VLAN assignment is correct and that the network interface has connectivity. Which of the following is MOST likely the issue the workstation is experiencing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
B wouldnt result in you getting a APIPA address. It would more likely cause mulitple IP conflicts and effect more than one person. C would effect more than one person and again, wouldnt result in you getting an APIPA address. D would also not give you an APIPA adress and you still might be able to communicate over the network, although with a different set of issues to deal with.
A is the most likely answer. An APIPA address is assigned to a device when it cannot obtain a valid IP address from a DHCP server.

Bing AI picks (A):
"The technician notes that the workstation is showing an Automatic Private IP Addressing (APIPA) address on the network interface. APIPA is a DHCP fail-safe mechanism that allows DHCP clients to obtain IP addresses even when DHCP servers are not functional. The APIPA address range is 169.254.0.1 to 169.254.254.255 with a default subnet mask of 255.255.0.0

Therefore, the most likely issue the workstation is experiencing is DHCP exhaustion or a rogue DHCP server. However, since the technician has verified that the VLAN assignment is correct and that the network interface has connectivity, it is more likely that the issue is DHCP exhaustion.

-An incorrect subnet mask would not cause an APIPA address to be assigned to the workstation. 
-A DNS server outage would not cause an APIPA address to be assigned to the workstation either."
Answer is A

Selected Answer: D
It's asking about what the workstation is experiencing, not what the DHCP server is experiencing. If the subnet mask is wrong on the workstation it will still give an APIPA address. I appreciate all explanations!

comments.content: It says the VLAN assignment is correct so subnet is has no problem

discussion.content:
DHCP exhaustion could be a reason
A rogue DHCP server could also give invalid IP and could result in APIPA fall back
Also a wrong subnet mask could also cause this
But, I will go for DHCP exhaustion (even though the question does not say others also face the issue.)

Selected Answer: A
APIPA (Automatic Private IP Addressing) is a feature built into Windows operating systems that allows a computer to automatically assign itself an IP address when it is unable to obtain one through DHCP. When DHCP exhaustion occurs, new clients that attempt to join the network will not be able to obtain an IP address from the DHCP server, and as a result, the computer will use an APIPA address to communicate on the network.

Selected Answer: A
What is DHCP exhaustion?

Each DHCP request with a different MAC address is regarded by the DHCP server as a new network client request. If the attacker sends an ample number of requests, the server's address pool will ultimately be exhausted. Hence, new network clients will be denied the DHCP service and will be unable to join the network.

questions.question_text: A network technician has determined the cause of a network disruption. Which of the following is the NEXT step for the technician to perform?

choices.C: Establish a plan of action to resolve the issue.
choices.A: Validate the findings in a top-to-bottom approach.

comments.content:
Isn't it 7 steps? 
From CompTIA's page "A guide to network troubleshooting"

1. Identify the Problem
2. Develop a Theory
3. Test the Theory
4. Plan of Action
5. Implement the Solution
6. Verify System Functionality
7. Document the Issue

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
1. Identify the problem. Done
2. Establish a theory of probable cause. Done 
3. Test the theory to determine the cause. The question states that he has "determined" the cause. Done
4. Establish a plan of action to resolve the problem and implement the solution

FYI
5. Verify full system functionality, and, if applicable, implement preventive measures
6. Document findings, actions and outcomes

Selected Answer: C
Step 3: Determine Cause
Step 4: Establish plan of action
C is CompTIAs next step.

Selected Answer: A
The technician has determined a probable cause, but has not tested any theories to find the source of that cause, this will require validating findings by doing a search through the network by a top-to-bottom approach where the technician has determined the source to help establish a plan of action to resolve the issue.

Might be wordplay though. :)

comments.content: It's not a probable cause, the technician determined the cause. Why are you adding words to the question?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
next step is to establish a plan, you have already determined a cause so there is no need to validate the findings
Do I get a dictionary to check what "determined" mean? Is it the theory or verified theory.

Selected Answer: C
Still can't wrap my head around why A is the chosen correct answer? That's what CompTIA says is right?

Selected Answer: C
C. Establish a plan of action to resolve the issue.

Once the network technician has determined the cause of a network disruption, the next step would be to establish a plan of action to resolve the issue. This plan should detail the steps that need to be taken to fix the problem and restore normal network operations. The plan should take into consideration the scope of the problem, the resources available, and the potential impact on the business.

Selected Answer: C
same as other noted with 7 steps , this is talking about step 4

Selected Answer: C
I think that if the cause has been determined, then that means that a theory was developed (step 2) and tested (step 3). At that point, since the cause has been determined, then a plan of action needs to be established (step 4) to remediate the issue.

Selected Answer: A
he has determined the cause ( = step 2: establish a theory of possible cause), so next step would be: step 3) Test the theory

Selected Answer: D
I would go for D. 'Whereas remote-access VPNs securely connect individual devices to a remote LAN, site-to-site VPNs securely connect two or more LANs in different physical locations. Site-to-site VPNs use the public internet to extend your company’s network across multiple office locations.' --> vpnmentor.com

I see many times that the highly answer is different from the "correct" answer. Can someone confirm which one 
are we supposed to follow?

Selected Answer: D
D is the most suitable for multiple offices.

Selected Answer: D
Site to Site

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D its says in comptia pdf///////////////////////////////////////////////

Selected Answer: A
I guess the correct answer is A. The key word is "satellite offices".
"Satellite offices" refers to smaller, remote locations or branch offices of a larger organization. These offices are typically located in different geographical areas and are separate from the organization's main headquarters or central office. Satellite offices are often established to extend the organization's reach, facilitate local operations, and serve customers in various regions. Satellite offices can vary in size and function. They might include regional sales offices, customer support centers, project teams, or any other operational unit that operates away from the main corporate location

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D
I want to know why the corect answer that this site give us is A

comments.content: its the vote that matters more but you havt to re read some of the questions becaues they can be trick questions

discussion.content: i will chosse D too but i dont want get confuse ..It is the community voting answers matter or the correct answers choosen by the site are the best one? want know plz

Selected Answer: D
D. Site-to-site VPN

A site-to-site VPN is a type of VPN connection that allows communication between two or more networks. In this case, the internal network of the corporate client would be connected to an external network, such as the internet, using a site-to-site VPN. This would allow the satellite offices to communicate securely with each other and with the headquarters using various ports and protocols.In summary, client-to-site VPN allows a single user to access a network remotely, while site-to-site VPN allows multiple networks to communicate and connect securely as if they were on the same local network.

comments.content: A client-to-site VPN, also known as a remote access VPN, allows individual users to connect to the internal network of a company from a remote location, using a VPN client installed on their device. This type of VPN is commonly used by employees who need to access the company's network while working remotely or traveling. It's also used for vendors and contractors who need to access the network.

discussion.content: D: It's about offices and not HomeOffices or road warriors (A)

Selected Answer: D
D final answer ditto
I agree with dechef001. D, final answer.

questions.question_text: Which of the following types of connections would need to be set up to provide access from the internal network to an external network so multiple satellite offices can communicate securely using various ports and protocols?

A corporate client is experiencing global system outages. The IT team has identified multiple potential underlying causes throughout the enterprise. Each team member has been assigned an area to troubleshoot. Which of the following approaches is being used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Divide-and-conquer.

The "divide-and-conquer" approach is a problem-solving strategy where a large, complex problem is broken down into smaller, more manageable parts. In this case, the IT team has identified multiple potential underlying causes for the global system outages, and each team member has been assigned an area to troubleshoot. This is an example of the divide-and-conquer approach, as the IT team is breaking down the large problem of global system outages into smaller, more manageable parts that can be investigated and resolved individually.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Ref: https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=102211&seqNum=5

questions.question_text: Which of the following use cases would justify the deployment of an mGRE hub-and-spoke topology?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. A network expansion caused by an increase in the number of branch locations to the headquarters 

mGRE is used with VPNs, and B is the only relevant answer

mGRE is commonly used in conjunction with the IPsec protocol to provide a secure VPN connection for remote clients.

Because mGRE is commonly used for VPN connections to remote clients, it is commonly implemented in remote offices or branch offices to a main company's HQ. A hub-and-spoke topology would also make sense as these branch locations are the spokes to the HQ's hub.

Selected Answer: B
B. A network expansion caused by an increase in the number of branch locations to the headquarters would justify the deployment of an mGRE (Multipoint Generic Routing Encapsulation) hub-and-spoke topology.

choices.C: A mandatory requirement to increase the deployment of an SDWAN network
choices.A: An increase in network security using encryption and packet encapsulation
choices.D: An improvement in network efficiency by increasing the useful packet payload
choices.B: A network expansion caused by an increase in the number of branch locations to the headquarters
